item.description: Pathologies can occur in any quadrant, level, line, state, or type. One example of a line or stream pathology is what Ken Wilber calls Boomeritis. Boomeritis refers specifically to a form of the pre/post fallacy whereby post-rational/worldcentric levels become infected with pre-rational/ego-centric levels. Though this dynamic can occur with respect to any tradition, Buddhism in the West has been particularly susceptible to it; thus the term Boomeritis Buddhism. We will explore this issue and go deeper in to Integral philosophy by reading Chapter 5 from Ken's "Integral Spirituality". This is sure to be a provocative discussion, as many Integralists are Buddhists, yet may find that the practices here in the West aren't truly Integral. So let's explore why this is, and what could be done to make a path truly Integral. (Please note: You will not have to bring a copy of the book, as handouts will be made available at this meetup.)
item.name: Boomeritis Buddhism
